Based on the search results, I found information about underground Polish comics and samizdat publications of Animal Farm during the communist era, particularly around 1985. Here's what I discovered:

## Polish Samizdat Animal Farm Comics in 1985

First edition of the comics based on George Orwell's Animal Farm. Polish samizdat comics of Orwell's Animal Farm were indeed published in Poland during the communist era. The search results reveal that 1985 was a significant year for this underground publication.

First edition of the comics based on George Orwell's Animal Farm was published as a samizdat (underground) edition. The publication details show it was (Warsaw): Gilosz & Azyl (Słowo), 1985. First edition, first issue (with price 120 zloty printed on rear cover). Oblong, format A5. Text in Polish.

## Context of Polish Underground Publishing

Throughout the Eastern Bloc, bibuła published until the collapse of communism was known also as samizdat. With the communist government losing power in the second half of the 1980s, production of Polish underground printing (bibuła) dramatically increased, and many publications were distributed throughout the entire country.

3 of every 4 responders in a research in Kraków by the Niezależne Biuro Badania Opinii Społecznej NSZZ „Solidarność" (Solidarity's Independent Public Opinion Poll Bureau) in 1985 claimed to read it underground publications.

## Risks and Production Methods

The publisher of this Animal Farm samizdat knew to expect serious consequences if caught – a fixed prison sentence of seven years and five years exile. These publications were typically produced using very poor quality (Polish: bibula lit. 'flimsy blotting paper'), text typewritten and distributed through underground networks.

The 1985 Polish samizdat comic adaptation of Animal Farm represents an important piece of underground resistance literature, demonstrating how Orwell's anti-totalitarian allegory was used by Polish dissidents to critique their own communist government during a crucial period of political change.
